name: Pinewoods Paths Player Aids
notes: Player aid card(s) for a retheme of Arboretum.
csv:
Text "

Setup

Remove some species from the game according to player count:

Players234
Species6810
Remove420

Deal 7 cards to each player. Place the remaining cards face down to form the draw pile.

" "

Turn Order

  1. Draw two cards.
    (You may draw from the draw pile, the top of any player's discard pile, or both.)
  2. Plant one card above, below or beside an already planted card.
  3. Discard one card face up in your personal discard pile.

When the draw pile runs out, finish your turn as usual, and then score.

" "

End Game

Determine who may score a path for each species:

  • The cards must be adjacent and in ascending order.
  • The path must start and end with the species.
  • You must have the highest total value of each species in hand. (A 1 in hand nullifies another player's 8.)
  • In case of ties (including 0), each of the tied players may score one path.
" "

Scoring Paths

Each qualifying path (but at most one per species per player) scores the following points:

  • One point per card.
  • Plus one point per card if all cards in the path are of the same species.
  • Plus 1 point for a 1.
  • Plus two points for an 8.

Total your path scores; the highest total wins.

" "

Species List

  • brown: White Pine tree (Pinus strobus)
  • green: Pitch Pine tree (Pinus rigida)
  • black: Black Gum tree a.k.a. Tupelo tree (Nyssa sylvatica)
  • blue: Highbush Blueberry bush (Vaccinium corymbosum)
  • red: Red Maple tree (Acer rubrum)
  • orange: White Oak tree (Quercus alba)
  • purple: Sassafras tree (Sassafras albidum)
  • yellow: Swamp Honeysuckle bush (Rhododendron viscosum)
  • pink: Groundnut vine (Apios americana)
  • gray: Sweet Pepperbush (Clethra alnifolia)
"
